headline.main: Two Doctors Honored for Work In Detecting Heart Risk Factors

docs.abstract: Amer Health Foundation, orgn devoted to preventive med, honors Drs T Dawber and W Kannel for their work in identifying risk factors that lead to heart disease, NYC, Apr 14; drs direct Framingham study, now in its 22d yr, which demonstrates that high blood pressure, excessive blood fats and cholesterol, cigarette smoking, obesity and lack of exercise makes avg middle-aged Amer male target for sudden death from heart attack; are presented with 1st E Dana Award at 1,000-calorie, low cholesterol luncheon; Repr Rogers s
docs.lead_paragraph: The American Health Foundation, an organization devoted to preventive medicine, yesterday honored Drs. Thomas Dawber and William Kannel for their work in identifying the risk factors that lead to heart disease.
docs.snippet: The American Health Foundation, an organization devoted to preventive medicine, yesterday honored Drs. Thomas Dawber and William Kannel for their work in identifying the risk factors that lead to heart disease.
